physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Obese, with a body mass index of 31 kg/mÂ². No other medical problems reported.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Insulin was begun at 22 weeks gestation when target glucose levels were not achieved with diet and exercise. Post-delivery, fasting glucose levels were normal before discharge.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Normal fasting glucose levels before discharge.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Postpartum glucose tolerance assessment is recommended at 6-12 weeks after delivery for diabetes risk.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial insulin therapy was necessary during pregnancy; however, insulin was discontinued immediately after delivery.
